bitfield.description: HW Reserved regiser
HW Reserved regiser
HW Reserved regiser
HW Reserved regiser

Controls the unhalting on the processor during the power-up sequence Write 1 : The DSP is kept in halt state at the end of the power up sequence. The L2 memories can now be initialised and loaded before setting this bit to 0, unhalting the processor and begin execution Write 0 : The processor is unhalted at the end of the power up sequence. Here the assumption is the code is already downloaded in L2 and the processor can immediatey being execution on power up.

Masks interrupts to the DSP. Write 1 : Mask interrupts to the DSP before powering off the DSP. When masked, any interrupts are now stored in the Missed event register. Write 0 : Send the interrupts to the DSP after power on.
Write pulse bit field: Trigger Power Up of the DSP. Write 1 : Triggers DSP power up sequence
Write pulse bit field: Trigger Power Down of the DSP. Write 1 : Triggers DSP power down sequence
Status bit indicating if there is an override for the DSP from Debug SubSystem. 0 : No override from DebugSS 1 : Override from DebugSS
Power Mode status of DSP 00 : Powered OFF 01 : Transitioning from OFF to ON state 10 : Transitioning from ON to OFF state 11 : Powered ON
Processor is halted
TI Internal Feature No of cycles to wait after de-assertion of GRSTN during DSP Power-up sequence. Max allowed value is 31.
TI Internal Feature No of cycles to wait after de-assertion of POR during DSP Power-up sequence. Max allowed value is 31.
TI Internal Feature No of cycles to wait after assertion of LRSTN during DSP Power-up sequence. Max allowed value is 31.
TI Internal Feature No of cycles to wait after assertion of GRSTN during DSP Power-up sequence. Max allowed value is 31.
TI Internal Feature No of cycles to wait after assertion of POR during DSP Power-up sequence. Max allowed value is 31.
HW RnD reserved. Do not Touch - Only for debug purpose
HW RnD reserved. Do not Touch - Only for debug purpose
TI Internal Feature 1:mask lresetout from DSPin FSM
TI Internal Feature No of cycles to wait after assertion of ISO_ENABLE during GEM power-down sequence. Max allowed value is 31.
TI Internal Feature No of cycles to wait after de-assertion of GEM_CLK_STOP_REQ during GEM Power-up sequence. Max allowed value is 31.
TI Internal Feature No of cycles to wait after de-assertion of LRSTN during DSP Power-up sequence. Max allowed value is 31.
TI Internal Feature Lreset output indication from GEM
TI Internal Feature Clock stop request ack from GEM
TI Internal Feature SDMA slave disable Done from clock stop ack from the master port of the async bridge present in the SDMA port.
TI Internal Feature SDMA Slave disable Ack from Interconnect. This is from the clock stop req signal coming from the slave port of the async bridge in SDMA.
TI Internal Feature Clock Stop request from SCR to SDMA Async Bridge
TI Internal Feature Memory AGOOD Output from GEM (synchronized to Bus clock)
TI Internal Feature Memory AON Output from GEM (synchronized to Bus clock)
TI Internal Feature Memory PGOOD Output from DSP (synchronized to Bus clock)
TI Internal Feature Memory PON Output from DSP (synchronized to Bus clock)
TI Internal Feature Logic PGOOD Output from DSP (synchronized to Bus clock)
TI Internal Feature Logic PON Output from DSP (synchronized to Bus clock)

This is the internal state of the DSP power State machine. Curretnly value of 13 needs to be polled to confirm we we can now download code to the L2 memory before unhalting the processor. Plan to change this in TPR and provide a single bit to poll on and move this to debug register since all the other states are irrelevant for SW
Bit level mask for each of the wakeup source bits [31:0] 1 : Masked 0 : Unmasked
Bit level mask for each of the wakeup source bits [63:32] 1 : Masked 0 : Unmasked.
Bit level mask for each of the wakeup source bits [95:64] 1 : Masked 0 : Unmasked.
Wakeup source status bits [31:0]
Wakeup source status bits [63:32]
Wakeup source status bits [95:64]
Write pulse bit field: Clear bit for wakeup source status bits [31:0]. Write 0x1 to clear the corrsponding status bit : Its a wspecial access type, write to this field will generate a pulse
Write pulse bit field: Clear bit for wakeup source status bits [63:32]. Write 0x1 to clear the corrsponding status bit : Its a wspecial access type, write to this field will generate a pulse
Write pulse bit field: Clear bit for wakeup source status bits [95:64]. Write 0x1 to clear the corrsponding status bit : Its a wspecial access type, write to this field will generate a pulse
Bit level mask for each of the missed events before getting pushed into DSP. Corresponds to Event lines[31:0] 1 : Masked 0 : Unmasked.
Bit level mask for each of the missed events before getting pushed into DSP. Corresponds to Event lines[63:32] 1 : Masked 0 : Unmasked.
Bit level mask for each of the missed events before getting pushed into DSP. Corresponds to Event lines[95:64] 1 : Masked 0 : Unmasked.
Missed events monitor status for interrupts [31:0]. Interrupts to DSP that are masked by INTERRUPT_MASK register field are captured in this register
Missed events monitor status for interrupts [63:32] Interrupts to DSP that are masked by INTERRUPT_MASK register field are captured in this register
Missed events monitor status for interrupts [95:64] Interrupts to DSP that are masked by INTERRUPT_MASK register field are captured in this register
DSP POR reset Bitwise Indication : Bit 0 : Por Reset Bit 1 : Sub system Reset from TOPRCM Bit 2 : Reset from DSS_RCM::DSS_DSP_RST_CTRL Bit 3 : Reset from Power FSM Bit 4 : Reset from STC FSM
DSP Greset Bitwise Indication : Bit 0 : Por Reset Bit 1 : Sub system Reset from TOPRCM Bit 2 : Reset from DSS_RCM::DSS_DSP_RST_CTRL Bit 3 : Reset from Power FSM Bit 4 : Reset from STC FSM

DSP Lreset Bitwise Indication : Bit 0 : Por Reset Bit 1 : Sub system Reset from TOPRCM Bit 2 : Reset from DSS_RCM::DSS_DSP_RST_CTRL Bit 3 : Reset from Debugss Bit 4 : Reset from Power FSM Bit 5 : Reset from STC FSM
Write pulse bit field: Write 0x1 to clear the reset cause register for any previous resets : Its a wspecial access type, write to this field will generate a pulse
No of clocks (in terms of 200 MHz DSPSS Bus clock) after asserting GEM TMODE VLCT signal before proceeding to the next state. Max allowed value is 31.
No of clocks (in terms of 200 MHz DSPSS Bus clock) after De-asserting GEM TMODE VLCT signal before proceeding to the next state. Max allowed value is 31.
[4:1] DSP PBIST SELFTEST KEY = 4'b1010
Enables back to Back STC.Needs to be set to 1 for self test

Mask bit for ignoring the clock stop ack from GEM. This will be used for ignoring clock stop ack during boot-up. 1 --> Ignore clock stop ack from GEM. 0 --> Wait for clock stop ack from GEM after giving clock stop request.
Configuration to halt the state machine before the final de-assertion of LRST to enable program download. 1 --> Halt, 0 --> Proceed.
Enable GEM STC during GEM power UP
Enable for PBIST and STC. 00 - Reserved, 01 --> STC only 10 --> PBIST only 11 --> PBIST followed by STC
PBIST status from GEM. undefined - Fail Indication undefined - Done indication
Current state of STC PBIST state machine
DSP PBIST STC misc Control
DSP PBIST STC misc Control
TI Internal Register.Reserved for HW RnD
TI Internal Register.Reserved for HW RnD
Write pulse bit field: Trigger pulse for the STC PBIST state machine. This is a self-clearing pulse. : Its a wspecial access type, write to this field will generate a pulse
Write pulse bit field: Clear bit for PBIST Status : Its a wspecial access type, write to this field will generate a pulse

Select line for selecting source clock for DSS DSP. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to TPR12 clock spec for source clock reference
Select line for selecting source clock for DSS HWA. Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : TOPRCM_CR5_CLK Write 3'b111 : TOPRCM_SYS_CLK

Select line for selecting source clock for DSS_RTIA. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to TPR12 clock spec for source clock reference

Select line for selecting source clock for DSS RTIB. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to TPR12 clock spec for source clock reference

Select line for selecting source clock for DSS Watchdog. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to TPR12 clock spec for source clock reference

Select line for selecting source clock for DSS SCIA. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if Clock source 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register. Refer to TPR12 clock spec for source clock reference
Divider value for DSS DSP selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.
Divider value for DSS RTIA selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.
Divider value for DSS RTIB selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.
Divider value for DSS Watchdog selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.
Divider value for DSS SCIA selected clock. Data should be loaded as multibit. For example: if divider value of 0x5 should be selected then 0x555 should be configured to the register.
Clock gatring config for DSS DSP. Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated
Clock gatring config for DSS HWA Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated
Clock gatring config for DSS RTA Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated
Clock gatring config for DSS RTIB Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated
Clock gatring config for DSS Watchdog Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated
Clock gatring config for DSS SCIA Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated
Clock gatring config for DSS SCIA Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000 : Clock is ungated Write 3'b111 : Clock is gated

Local Reset control for DSS DSP Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000: Reset is not asserted by SW. There could be another reset source which could reset the module. Refer to RCM spec for more details Write 3'b111 : Reset is asserted by SW

Global Reset control forDSS DSP Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000: Reset is not asserted by SW. There could be another reset source which could reset the module. Refer to RCM spec for more details Write 3'b111 : Reset is asserted by SW

Power on Reset control for DSS DSP Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000: Reset is not asserted by SW. There could be another reset source which could reset the module. Refer to RCM spec for more details Write 3'b111 : Reset is asserted by SW
This feature is for debug purpose only. Software needs to ensure the state of Device/IP before configuring. Writing 3'b11 will assert reset for DSS ESM

This feature is for debug purpose only. Software needs to ensure the state of Device/IP before configuring. Writing 3'b11 will assert reset for DSS MCRC

Write pulse bit field: DSP Dithered Clock LFSR Load
DSP Dithered Clock Enable. Write 3'b000 : Disabled Write 3'b111 : Enabled
DSP Dithered Clock LFSR Seed

Sticky bit for DSS L3 PD CTRL. Write 3'b111 to lock the configuration of DSS_L3_BANK*_PD_CTRL. Once this field is writen, there is no impact of changing the value of aonin and agoodin fields in DSS_L3_BANK*_PD_CTRL registers

This register is for Debug Purposes only. Reset control for DSS HWA Data should be loaded as multibit. Write 3'b000: Reset is not asserted by SW. There could be another reset source which could reset the module. Refer to RCM spec for more details Write 3'b111 : Reset is asserted by SW

Proxy0 access violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error. Raw status is read. Write a 1 to set the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Proxy0 access violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error. Enabled status is read. Write a 1 to clear the status. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Proxy0 access violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error enable. Write a 1 to set the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Proxy0 access violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Kick access violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Addressing violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
Protection violation error enable clear. Write a 1 to clear the enable. Writing a 0 has no effect.
EOI vector value. Write this with interrupt distribution value in the chip.
Fault Address.
Non-secure access.

Fault Type 10_0000 = Supervisor read fault - priv = 1 dir = 1 dtype != 1 01_0000 = Supervisor write fault - priv = 1 dir = 0 00_1000 = Supervisor execute fault - priv = 1 dir = 1 dtype = 1 00_0100 = User read fault - priv = 0 dir = 1 dtype = 1 00_0010 = User write fault - priv = 0 dir = 0 00_0001 = User execute fault - priv = 0 dir = 1 dtype = 1 00_0000 = No fault
Route ID.
Privilege ID.
Fault clear. Writing a 1 clears the current fault. Writing a 0 has no effect.
